instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>
threads.message:
i replaced <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> (new chip)and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> (from donor board), there is green light, i can do SMC reset
-the board takes 0.380A when i connect the charger, than that goes back to 0.200A and stays there

i see no water else where, only on those 2 chips, and some resistors around, i replaced all of them, no here is the measurement for

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>
threads.message: so my <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> is not giving 3.3V on the leg 1, so the crystals are not working?   the leg 1 was corroded, i removed it, pad cleaned, chip replaced, but still no 3.3

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>
threads.message: i replaced <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and the 25 mhz chrystal again, same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>
threads.message:
Did you check resistance to grounat pin 1/<CHIP>U1900</CHIP>?
If OK, then check for 3V at pins 2 & 13 of <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>.

25MHz will not appear untill board starts.
You must get first 32KHz at pin 12.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>
threads.message:
i dont have 32khz too

1/<CHIP>U1900</CHIP>  is 1ohm, that pin goes the the CPU, doesn it mean cpu is shorted?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>
threads.message: If you have a short on pin 1, you need to remove <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> first to see if it goes away. If not, the cap next to it can cause the short. If not that, there are 4 other big caps on the board for RTC. If you remove all 5 caps and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and it’s still 1 ohm, then yes dead CPU
